course.subject: PHYS
course.name: Introduction to Stellar Astrophysics
course.description: Stellar radiation, stellar spectrum, binary stars, interiors of stars, star formation, post-main-sequence stellar evolution, stellar remnants.

reviews.author: WhatAh
reviews.comment_content:
基本上係跟A. C. Phillips嘅The Physics of Stars教
不過有時powerpoint會教多少少

Chapter 1
Basic Concepts in Astrophysics (6 lectures)
Gravitational Contraction (1.2)
Star formation (1.3)
The Sun (1.4)
Nucleosynthesis (1.1, 1.5)
Stellar Life cycles (1.6)
Family of stars (1.7)

Chapter 2
Matter and Radiation (4 lectures)
Gases in Stars (2.1)
Electrons in Stars (2.2)
Photons in Stars (2.3 - 2.4)

Chapter 3
Heat Transfers in Stars (2 lectures)
Heat Transfer by Random Motion (3.1)
Heat Transfer by Convection (3.2 - 3.3)

Chapter 4
Thermonuclear Fusion in Stars (4 lectures)
Nuclear Fusion (4.1)
Hydrogen Burning (4.2)
Helium Burning (4.3)
Advanced Burning (4.4)

Chapter 5
Stellar Structure (3 lectures)
Simple Stellar Models (5.1-5.2)
Modeling the Sun (5.3)
Minimum and Maximum Stellar Masses (5.4)

Chapter 6
The Endpoints of Stellar Evolution (4 lectures)
White Dwarfs (6.1)
Stellar Collapse (6.2)
Neutron Stars (6.3)
Black Holes (6.4)（教唔切）
reviews.comment_teaching:
每一堂都係跟powerpoint教
唔算照讀，解得算清楚
跟住最後15分鐘會有classwork
唔會好難同埋可以同人討論
reviews.comment_grading:
Classwork　20%
Quiz　20%
Midterm　30%
Presentation and report　30%

Classwork唔難不過迫你出席
Quiz考記憶力同推公式，熟書就得
Midterm今年幾難
Mean只有一半
最高分同滿分亦有距離
主要係時間比較短好多人做唔切
Final係present+report(算短)

A range算窄
Mean B-
Stat可以睇attachment
reviews.comment_workload:
完全無功課
得classwork
PHYS入面比較有人性嘅course

reviews.comment_teaching: Michael was really a nice professor I met ever in HKUST. I met him during my secondary school study due to the training of IPhO. Tho he just read through the powerpoint throughout the lesson, when you have something do not understand, you can just directly ask him and Tony Shing (TA) after the lecture and he was really willing to clarify all the things.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is really nice. Yet, he disclosed all the marks, including yourself, to your classmates. You will know everyone's marks and even know your position. You will also know the grading of all other peoples.

The grading system is as follows:
Classwork
20%

Quiz
20%

Midterm
30%

Presentation and report
30%

I got third in midterm (out of 19 ppl), full mark in classwork, 7th in quizzes , 15th in presentation and report (due to my freeride exchange partner omfg)
Overall 79.37/100, positioned 7, B+
reviews.comment_workload:
Quite heavy workload in classes. You must attend all the lectures as there is a classwork after every lecture. Actually if you remember all the derivation, you can easily get a very good result in quizzes and midterm, but you need quite a bit time to spend on memorisation because usually you will mix up the things as they are so similar.
Well, quite a heavy workload for me in presentation and report because my partner freeride me.
NO homework.

reviews.author: TiffChan
reviews.title: Is a new teacher and I think she teach quite good as her first time teaching
reviews.comment_content:
The course suppose referring to A. C. Phillips, The Physics of Stars but I did not read the book at all so I don't know if professor is following the book or she is randomly picking topics.

There is a class schedule in canvas syllabus but I don't think we are following the schedule. But at least everything is related to Astrophysics.

I think I don't have much to say about content because I am not majoring in Physics but I would say u need to memorise fundamental concepts and physics knowledge so that u know what happened in class.
reviews.comment_teaching:
As a non-physics student studying astrophysics minor, I think professor is doing great coz she will describe more about the fundamentals before going on to advance topics (or maybe she afraid me don't know what she is teaching)

She does hand-written notes in class and release the notes after the lecture, so actually cannot study beforehand. and be prepared to jot notes quickly.
reviews.comment_grading:
Classwork 20% (if u attend class but do not submit the classwork u can still get some marks.)
I do all of them and all correct so full marks for me.

4 Quizzes 20% (choose 3 highest)
quiz 1 45/50
quiz 2 41/60
quiz 3 45/? (I forgot is 50 or 60)
quiz 4 36/40

Midterm exam 30%
73/100

Final presentation and report 30%
76/100
actually this marks is quite complicated cause prof, TA and peer review all contribute to this mark.
presentation should be (10min present + 5 min Q&A) but because we have peer review so everyone need to ask at least one question to presenter, and professor will ask more than one question so BE PREPARED, make sure u know what u are presenting (every single word or phrases may asked in the Q&A session) so u at least need to answer 8-9 questions.
so at last each of us present around 45 mins including the Q&A.

we only have 6 ppl in this semester
and I mostly in lower quartile (second last) (the last one seems to be the exchange student who disappear in the middle of the semester)

Overall I got B+. did not expect this grade as a non-physics student.
reviews.comment_workload:
only classworks

we have 4 quizzes so if u want to get high marks then u probably need to study.

BUT group report becomes individual cause we only have 6 ppl in class. Quite chur as a non-physics student who never wrote an physics academic report and u needa find extremely many research paper (I find around 5x papers though I only use half of them in the report)

reviews.author: Zechidlin
reviews.comment_content: Basically follows the life cycle of a star to develop the discussion. This course relies heavily on mathematical skills, or should I say, it is a combination of quantum mechanics, relativistic theories, written in huge amount of math stuffs. After the first two lectures all slides provided are emerged in tons of equations, which makes revision for final somehow suffering as you need to go through the equations and try to understand them.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof. Ng was kind and willing to answer questions. His pace was rather slow so it was easy to catch up. TA Zhu mian gave very detailed explanations on hw and was helpful.
reviews.comment_grading: Very good grade. 10% participation mark, 5% for lectures and another 5% for tutorials; hw 25%, and our TA Zhu mian was very lenient to grade them, as long as your process was correct, even you made mistakes in calculations the mark deduction was quite tiny ( so was the final). Project report 15%, you need to select your own topic in stellar physics and write a 3-page report. Final 50%, Zhu mian graded it extremely leniently….He  was very kind. Everyone got a mark higher than their anticipation…though I don’t know if this is the ‘actual’ case, but at least mine is. So the final grade was quite good.
reviews.comment_workload: Very light, 2 problems per week, and their difficulty was relatively low.

reviews.author: Adrianop
reviews.title: 被某位phys大神既review拉左去讀stellar既讀後感
reviews.comment_content:
How can we model a star qualitatively
(or be more precise, main sequence stars)
How star forms, how star evolutes, and how star dies.
(basically you can fully understand those documentaries about stars after this course)

If you have interest in astronomy and generally don't aim very high grade, this course is good for you.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Good teaching due to small class
(this year only 16 students took this course)
Prof. can explain complicated ideas in a relatively easier way for us to understand. He can respond to our question effectively, (and he sometimes make jokes)
Mark release of courseworks on canvas are quite efficient.
(in a very short period after completion of the respective coursework)

(much better than my major's prof. in general, which is mech)
reviews.comment_grading:
Fair. Not bad, only slightly good grade.
Got 8x/100 (rank 2 out of 16)
And got an A in final grade.
No A+ this year, probably because my marks is nearly the same with the highest mark in this class(differ by only 0.03)
The grade curve just followed the university standard(slightly better in B range sub grades)
reviews.comment_workload:
5 quizzes
Midterm
Classwork at the other half of every class(not difficult, and deadline is actually the next day)
A report on astronomy topic you are interested and a gp presentation on that report.

The workload is quite high especially before quizzes and midterm, and I really need to have both good understanding and good memorization to get a good quiz/midterm result.

reviews.author: kit1236
reviews.comment_content: The course cover structures and physics of various types of stars and related objects, from how a main-sequence stars forms, stellar infrastructure to how different stars die and the physics of white dwarfs and neutron stars.
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is quite good and most students focus on the lesson. the class work is sometime too long so we need to do them after class and hand in at that day.
reviews.comment_grading: Quite good grading, maybe due to small class size
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is quite high especially before quizzes and midterm, as not much formula is provided so we need to memorize quite a lot of equations. Usually not quite enough time to prove the equations if one don't remember them.
